benchmark_details.name: C-VQA (Counterfactual Visual Question Answering)
benchmark_details.overview: C-VQA is a novel dataset designed to examine the counterfactual reasoning capabilities of multi-modal large language models. It consists of original questions infused with counterfactual presuppositions to evaluate the reasoning abilities of models.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate counterfactual reasoning abilities in multi-modal language models.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset currently includes a limited number of images, affecting the comprehensiveness of evaluation.

data.source: Constructed using original questions from VQAv2 and generating new counterfactual questions.
data.annotation: Manually annotated by experts and verified for correctness.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on model performance on original vs. counterfactual questions.
methodology.interpretation: High performance indicates better reasoning capabilities in counterfactual scenarios.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance metrics varied, showing drops of up to 40% for counterfactual questions.
methodology.validation: Comparative evaluation with existing state-of-the-art models.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Yes, the dataset includes an analysis of biases in answering based on gender-related questions.
harm: Bias in handling gender-related counterfactual questions
